alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:22PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Wasatch...south central Morgan and southwestern Summit Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 321 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from South Snyderville Basin to Oakley to 7 miles northeast of Samak. Movement was north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Park City, Coalville, Summit Park, Kamas, Oakley, Wanship, South Snyderville Basin, North Snyderville Basin, East Canyon State Park, Samak, Peoa, Hoytsville, Echo Reservoir, Snyderville, Kimball Junction, Marion, Jordanelle Reservoir and Rockport State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 143 and 166. US Route 40 between mile markers 0 and 9. Mirror Lake Highway between mile markers 0 and 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains
